channel.title: Loud Legends: The Latest Rock and Heavy Metal News on Loud Legends
channel.description: Recent content in Loud Legends: The Latest Rock and Heavy Metal News on Loud Legends

item.title: Ice Nine Kills Drummer Patrick Galante Steps Down
item.description: Patrick Galante has left Ice Nine Kills after 6 years with the band.

item.title: Judas Priest's Rob Halford: "Political Debates Are Harder Than Ever"
item.description: Rob Halford comments on the growing political polarization, lamenting the loss of civil debates.

item.title: Static-X: No Full Albums, But Maybe Singles, Says Tony Campos
item.description: Tony Campos says Static-X will continue as long as the band is having fun and fans keep showing up.

item.title: Watch: Korn Celebrates 30 Years with Epic Anniversary Concert in Los Angeles
item.description: Korn celebrated their 30th anniversary with a massive show at BMO Stadium in Los Angeles, featuring special guests like Evanescence, Gojira, and more.

item.title: Watch: DREAM THEATER Releases 'Night Terror' Video Ahead of 'Parasomnia' Album
item.description: DREAM THEATER announces new album “Parasomnia”, releasing February 7, 2025.

item.title: John 5 Breaks Silence on Relationship With Rob Zombie After Joining Mötley Crüe
item.description: John 5 hasn’t spoken to Rob Zombie since leaving his band to join Mötley Crüe in 2022, though there’s no bad blood.

item.title: KORN's Debut Album Turns 30: Jonathan Davis Reflects on the Band's Legacy
item.description: KORN celebrated the 30th anniversary of their self-titled debut album with a special concert at BMO Stadium in Los Angeles.

item.title: Shavo Odadjian’s Seven Hours After Violet Drops New Single "Cry"; VIDEO
item.description: Seven Hours After Violet, led by Shavo Odadjian, releases the music video for their single “Cry.

item.title: Scott Stapp Reflects on Sobriety: "Drinking is No Longer an Option"
item.description: Scott Stapp opens up about maintaining sobriety and creating a sober environment while on tour.

item.title: Cradle of Filth to Release New Single: Dani Filth Promises Fans Will "Love It"
item.description: Cradle of Filth will release a new single in October 2024, ahead of their European tour.

item.title: Roger Miret Opens Up His Hardcore Archives in "With Time"
item.description: Roger Miret releases a new book, “With Time,” chronicling the early years of Agnostic Front and the rise of the New York hardcore scene.

item.title: James Hetfield: "We Don’t Want to Be a Legacy Band That Only Plays Hits"
item.description: James Hetfield states Metallica doesn’t want to become a “legacy band” that only plays greatest hits.

item.title: SKILLET's John Cooper on Political Divides in Rock: "We're Shut Out"
item.description: John Cooper of SKILLET shares how his political and faith-based views have led to exclusion in the music industry.

item.title: Slipknot and Estate of Joey Jordison Settle Lawsuit Quietly
item.description: Settlement Reached: Joey Jordison’s estate and Slipknot have settled a lawsuit, with terms undisclosed.

item.title: Everything You Need to Know About the "Loud Legends" Website
item.description: Welcome to Loud Legends—your ultimate source for everything rock and metal.
